title: U.S. finds Ethiopian troops committed crimes against humanity
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced the Ethiopia assessment as he unveiled the State Department’s annual report on global human rights.

title: Somalia drought caused 43,000 deaths in 2022, report estimates
description: Somalia has endured five consecutive failed rainy seasons, and may soon see its sixth.

title: Report: Shooting kills 3 Kurds celebrating new year in Syria
description: Syrian opposition activists and state media say that Turkey-backed opposition fighters have shot dead at least three Kurds who were celebrating the new year by lighting a fires to mark the occasion leading to tensions in the area

title: Earthquake-battered parts of Turkey hit by severe flooding
description: Piles of debris, cars, and in some cases, people, were carried away by fast-racing floodwater, after heavy rains last week.

title: Bad Bunny's ex-girlfriend files lawsuit seeking $40M
description: Bad Bunny’s ex–girlfriend is suing the superstar for at least $40 million over a well-known voice recording she provided the singer before he became famous

title: Venezuela's oil czar resigns amid corruption investigations
description: Venezuela’s oil czar has announced his resignation as officials investigate alleged corruption among public officials

title: Macron narrowly overcomes no-confidence vote as anger in France intensifies
description: It was not an easy victory and is not likely to ease the unrest.

title: Guatemala seeks to remove opposition candidate's immunity
description: A government prosecutor in Guatemala has asked a court to lift the immunity of one of the candidates in the country’s June presidential elections, because the candidate asked about a judge’s motive in prosecuting journalists

title: Body found, 6 missing after fire at illegal AirBnB in Canada
description: Montreal’s mayor is vowing to better regulate Airbnb in her city as the search continues for six people missingthrough a building that included Airbnb units in a historic city section where they are banned

title: US company says Mexican police illegally seized property
description: A U.S. company says Mexican police and soldiers illegally seized a cargo port it operates on land it owns on Mexico’s Caribbean coast

title: Mauritania’s ancient libraries could be lost to the expanding desert
description: This Mauritanian city boasts 13 libraries and some 6,000 manuscripts. Their teachings range from Islamic law to poetry to mathematics.

title: 3 stabbed at Canadian hospital, student in custody
description: Police say a student has been arrested on suspicion of stabbing three people at a high school in Canada’s Atlantic coast city of Halifax

title: Dominican police arrest 19 in high-profile corruption case
description: Authorities in the Dominican Republic have arrested 19 people in a sweeping corruption case that accuses a well-known former presidential candidate and three former officials of embezzling nearly $350 million and illegal campaign financing

title: Thai officials trace missing radioactive cylinder to foundry
description: Officials in Thailand have traced to a recycling foundry a metal cylinder with radioactive contents that had gone missing from a power plant

title: French journalist kidnapped in Mali in 2021 is freed
description: France’s president Emmanuel Macron and media rights group Reporters Without Borders say a French journalist held hostage by Islamic extremists for nearly two years in Mali has been released

title: N. Ireland unionists say no to Sunak's Brexit deal, for now
description: Northern Ireland’s main British unionist party says it will vote against a deal struck by Britain and the European Union to resolve a thorny trade dispute that vexed U.K.-EU relations

title: American hostage freed from captivity in Africa
description: Jeffery Woodke, a Christian aid worker, was abducted in Niger in 2016.

title: Yemeni sides say deal reached to free nearly 900 prisoners
description: Yemen’s warring sides say they have agreed to release nearly 900 prisoners of war in a U.N.-brokered deal amid international efforts to end the yearslong conflict

title: Drone strikes, sabotage, shelling: Russia’s war on Ukraine comes to Russia
description: The war now encroaches on the daily lives of Russian citizens with near-constant reports of fires, drone attacks and shelling.

title: Speaker of Czech parliament's lower house to visit Taiwan
description: The speaker of the Czech Parliament’s lower house is set to visit Taiwan to boost mutual ties, a step that has angered China

title: International Red Cross says 2 kidnapped staff freed in Mali
description: The International Committee of the Red Cross says that two of its staff members were freed in Mali on Monday

title: Palestinian commander killed in Syria buried in refugee camp
description: A Palestinian militant commander who was shot and killed in Syria has been buried in refugee camp on the edges of the Syrian capital, Damascus

title: Amid turmoil, Israel shows signs of blinking on judicial overhaul
description: While promising to pause some aspects of the overhaul, the right-wing government still vowed to enact measures to give it more say in selecting Supreme Court judges.

title: South Africans demonstrate and call for president to resign
description: South African police on Monday monitored protests by the country’s leftist Economic Freedom Fighters party, which is demanding the resignation of President Cyril Ramaphosa

title: EU hosts fundraising meeting for Turkey, Syria after quake
description: The European Union and its international partners are gathered in Brussels to raise money for Turkey and Syria in the aftermath of the earthquake that devastated parts of both countries last month

title: Xi arrives in Russia to stand with Putin against West amid Ukraine war
description: With war raging in Ukraine, Chinese leader Xi Jinping landed in Russia for a three-day state visit that Russian officials have billed as the most important diplomatic event of 2023.

title: Activists demand EU halts 'green' funds for Spain ski resort
description: Spanish environmental groups have called on the European Union to open an inquiry into the approval of 26.4 million euros of “green” recovery funds to join two ski resorts in the rapidly warming Pyrenees mountain range

title: Arrests as Kenya opposition leads anti-government protests
description: At least three Kenyan legislators and several protesters have been arrested in ongoing protests in Kenya’s capital, Nairobi, organized by the opposition demanding the resignation of President William Ruto

title: Man arrested after windows smashed at Indian mission in UK
description: British police say windows at India’s High Commission in London were smashed and two security guards were slightly injured during a demonstration by Sikh protesters

title: Report: 43,000 estimated dead in Somalia drought last year
description: A new report says an estimated 43,000 people died amid the longest drought on record in Somalia last year and half of them likely were children

title: Avalanche: 2nd body found of Swedish skiers near Mont Blanc
description: Rescue crews have recovered a second body during a search for two Swedish skiers who were caught in an avalanche near Mont Blanc on Italy’s northern border with France

title: EU seeks deal on artillery shells for Ukraine
description: European Union ministers are meeting to try to finalize a plan to supply Ukraine with sorely needed artillery shells, replenish their own national stocks and ramp up Europe’s defense industry

title: Millions of rotting fish to be removed from Outback river
description: Authorities in Australia say they’re arranging for the removal of millions of rotting fish from an Outback river

title: UN science report to provide stark climate warning
description: A major new United Nations report being released Monday is expected to provide a sobering reminder that time is running out if humanity wants to avoid passing a dangerous global warming threshold

title: Their world was the oyster: Oldest pearl town found in UAE
description: Archaeologists say they have found the oldest pearling town in the Persian Gulf on an island off one of the northern sheikhdoms of the United Arab Emirates

title: What is China’s relationship with Russia, and with Ukraine?
description: Xi Jinping is set to travel to Russia on Monday to meet with Vladimir Putin. Here’s how relations between their countries stand amid the war in Ukraine.

title: Ukraine live updates: Xi to visit Putin in Russia, in first trip since Ukraine war
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s upcoming meeting with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin is seen as a morale boost, as the war in Ukraine drags into its second year.

title: How Iraq’s children of war found their voice after the American invasion
description: Fayhaa, Mohamed and Hajer belong to a generation that grew up in the shadow of the American invasion and are still reckoning with what it means to be Iraqi.

title: Former Australian soldier to be charged with Afghan's murder
description: Police have arrested the first Australian veteran for an alleged murder in Afghanistan three years after a war crime investigation found that 19 Australian special forces soldiers could face charges for illegal conduct during the conflict

title: Former Taiwan leader Ma Ying-jeou will visit China
description: Former Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou will visit China next week, in what a spokesman called a bid to ease tensions between the self-ruled island and the mainland

title: How the U.S. broke Iraq
description: The war, driven by the hubris of the Bush administration and a cheerleading Washington establishment, is now widely seen as a generational American mistake.
